item.title: BLO Deaths During Voter List Work — What You Need to Know
item.description:
BLO Deaths During Voter List Work — What You Need to Know

A short, simple guide + how you can take action

In the last few weeks, several Booth Level Officers (BLOs) across India have died while working on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists. Families, teachers’ groups, and unions say the workload, long hours, and tight deadlines may have contributed in some cases. The Supreme Court has also stepped in and asked states to reduce the pressure by adding more staff.

item.title: Take Action: Ask for Safer Work Conditions for BLOs
item.description:
A simple 2–minute step to help protect people doing essential field work

The quickest and most effective way to help is to file a calm, polite complaint on your State Election Commission (SEC) website. You do this as a citizen, and it is completely legal and voluntary.

A few strong complaints from citizens can push the government to:

  • extend unsafe deadlines
  • add more staff
  • reduce pressure on BLOs
  • prevent future harm

Your voice makes a difference.
